page.title: 05Rookwood Hospital, Llandaff.
page.content: The hospital lies on Fairwater road. It is a fairly small hospital with 154 beds, and 8 Wards, though ward 6 is out of use due to improvements being made. The main groups of patients are pre-convelescent from other hospitals, spinal injuries and brain surgery. The hospital has 145 nurses. On a spinal injury ward there should be 7 or more nurses at one time; other wards have less. The most common causes of injury are car accidents on ice and sporting (rugby) accidents in winter, motorbike accidents and water sport during summer. The main age group of patients are 20-30 yrs, and 60-70 yrs. The hospital costs millions of pounds to run: It is cheaper to cater for 'out patients' than those staying in hospital.
